Package com.shouldis.bitset

Class BitSpliterator

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.shouldis.bitset.BitSpliterator
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.util.Spliterator<java.lang.Integer>, java.util.Spliterator.OfInt, java.util.Spliterator.OfPrimitive<java.lang.Integer,​java.util.function.IntConsumer,​java.util.Spliterator.OfInt>
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    BitSpliterator.Array, BitSpliterator.Dead, BitSpliterator.Live, BitSpliterator.Range, BitwiseSpliterator
    public abstract class BitSpliterator
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.util.Spliterator.OfInt
    Implementation of Spliterator that is meant to be used in conjunction with BitSets. This class allows for parallel processing on the indices of a BitSet such that those operations will never enter race conditions on the underlying longs within BitSet.words. This behavior can only be guaranteed if the indices returned by the BitSpliterator are manipulated, and not some offset or translation. This bounding of indices to specific threads is needed because of the non-atomic nature of modifying long. Using a generic parallel IntStream would cause changes to the underlying long words of a BitSet to be potentially overridden by other threads.

    This class offers 4 implementations:

    • BitSpliterator.Array
    • BitSpliterator.Range
    • BitSpliterator.Live
    • BitSpliterator.Dead
    Author:
    Aaron Shouldis
    See Also:
    BitSet

    • Nested Class Summary

      Nested Classes 
      Modifier and Type Class Description
      static class  BitSpliterator.Array
      Implementation of BitSpliterator used to stream all values within a specified integer array representing indices in an order appropriate to manipulate a BitSet in parallel.
      static class  BitSpliterator.Dead
      Implementation of BitSpliterator used to stream the indices of dead bits within a BitSet, splitting at appropriate indices to manipulate a BitSet in parallel.
      static class  BitSpliterator.Live
      Implementation of BitSpliterator used to stream the indices of live bits within a BitSet, splitting at appropriate indices to manipulate a BitSet in parallel.
      static class  BitSpliterator.Range
      Implementation of BitSpliterator used to stream all indices of a specified range, splitting at appropriate indices to manipulate a BitSet in parallel.

    • Constructor Detail

      • BitSpliterator

        protected BitSpliterator​(int position,
                         int end)
        Creates a BitSpliterator with the specified starting and ending position.
        Parameters:
        position - (inclusive) the first index to include.
        end - (exclusive) index after the last index to include.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if position is greater than or equal to end.

    • Method Detail

      • stream

        public final java.util.stream.IntStream stream()
        Returns a stream operating off of this BitSpliterator. Defaulting to serial, BaseStream.parallel() may be called to safely process the indices produced in parallel safely.
        Returns:
        a stream representation of this BitSpliterator.

      • splitIndex

        protected int splitIndex()
        Calculates an appropriate place to split this BitSpliterator considering the current position and end.
        Returns:
        an appropriate place to split this BitSpliterator

      • middle

        protected int middle()
        Calculates the index in the middle index of this BitSpliterator using the current position and end. Performs calculations such that there cannot be an overflow due to large integers.
        Returns:
        the middle index of this BitSpliterator.

      • nextLiveBit

        protected int nextLiveBit​(long word,
                          int wordIndex)
        Calculates the index of the next live bit within a specified word that is at the specified wordIndex within BitSet.words. This index will represent its bit index in the underlying long array as well as the offset within the integer word.
        Parameters:
        word - the long word to be checked for a live bit.
        wordIndex - the index of the word within BitSet.words.
        Returns:
        the index of the next live bit within the specified word, or end if none are found.
